It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, often in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Brillantaisia ulugurica is considered a vulnerable species.
